msContents.summary: Notification of the death of a slave, Apollophanes, a weaver, by his master Sarapion. The notification is addressed to Philiskos, a tax farmer for the tax on weaving. Dated in the 7th year of Nero and signed by Philiskos

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; on the verso, 4 lines, effaced. The first line is probably the name Philiskos
22 lines; broken at right and bottom left corner. Only 1-2 letters are missing at the right
The hand is a fine, fluent cursive
The last 4 lines are in the hand of Philiskos, thickly written

provenance.p: Given to Columbia University by the Egypt Exploration Society, 1901

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: To Philiskos, farmer of the tax on weaving, from Sarapion son of Sarapion. My slave Apollophanes, a weaver, registered in Temgenouthis Square, died abroad in the present 7th year of Nero Claudius Caesar AugustusGermanicus Imperator. Wherefore I request that his name be inscribed in the list of dead persons, and I swear by Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus Imperator that this information is true. Year 7 of Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus Imperator, Mecheir 27th, august day. (2nd hand) I, Philiskos, have signed. Year 7 of Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus Imperator, Mecheir 27th, august day.
